name: tiktokenizer
readme_summary: The Tiktokenizer repository is an online playground for the `openai/tiktoken` library. It allows users to calculate the number of tokens required for a given prompt, which is crucial for working with OpenAI models and managing API costs. The project is built using the T3 Stack and is sponsored by Diagram.
primary_use_case: Calculating the number of tokens for a given prompt to optimize usage of OpenAI models.
cover_image_prompt: A librarian meticulously organizing scrolls of text into labeled jars representing different token counts. The librarian uses a magnifying glass to examine the text, ensuring accurate categorization. Small UI elements displaying token numbers float around the scene. The setting is a cozy, futuristic library with warm lighting. Digital particles representing data flow between the scrolls and jars. The repository name, 'Tiktokenizer,' is subtly displayed on a bookshelf. The composition is clean and focused with a warm color scheme. The image should be in 3D isometric illustration style with rich details and vibrant colors.

name: noisedash
description: Self-hostable web tool for generating ambient noises
readme_summary: Noisedash is a self-hostable web application designed for generating and customizing ambient noises. It allows users to create personalized soundscapes by combining generated noises with uploaded audio samples, applying audio processing effects, and saving noise profiles for easy access and sharing. The application also includes admin tools for managing multiple users and is designed to be mobile-friendly.
key_features: Generate and customize ambient noises using Tone.js
Save, import, and export noise profiles
Fine-tune noises with audio processing tools (filters, LFOs, effects)
Admin tools for managing multiple users
primary_use_case: Creating and customizing ambient noise soundscapes for relaxation, focus, or other purposes.
cover_image_prompt: A sound engineer sits at a mixing console, surrounded by glowing sound waves that visualize various ambient noises like rain, wind, and forest sounds. The console has labeled knobs for adjusting parameters like filters and effects. A screen displays a simplified UI of Noisedash, showing noise profiles being saved and loaded. The scene is set in a modern, minimalist studio with soft, diffused lighting. Small digital particles representing audio samples float around the engineer. The composition is clean and focused, using a calming color scheme of blues and greens. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with rich details.

name: receipthero
description: Organize all your receipts with AI
readme_summary: ReceiptHero is an open-source receipt management application that uses AI-powered OCR to extract data from receipt images. It allows users to upload receipts, automatically categorize expenses, and view spending breakdowns, storing data locally for privacy.
key_features: Data extraction (vendor, date, amount, items, currency, payment method)
primary_use_case: Organizing and managing receipts with AI-powered data extraction and categorization.
cover_image_prompt: Imagine a diligent librarian meticulously organizing a chaotic pile of paper receipts into neatly labeled digital folders. The librarian uses a magnifying glass that emits a soft, digital glow, revealing key information like dates, amounts, and vendors, which then automatically populates the folders on a nearby holographic screen. The folders are color-coded by expense category. Subtle UI elements and data visualizations float in the background. The scene is set in a bright, modern library with a clean and organized aesthetic. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with vibrant colors and clear details.

name: Code2Video
readme_summary: Code2Video is a project focused on generating educational videos from code. It presents a code-centric paradigm for creating teaching videos, potentially leveraging multi-agent systems to automate the video creation process. The project provides resources such as a paper, dataset, and project website for further exploration.
primary_use_case: Generating educational videos based on code execution and logic.
cover_image_prompt: A friendly robot teacher standing in a brightly lit classroom, writing code on a holographic whiteboard. As the robot writes, the code transforms into animated scenes projected onto a large screen behind it, illustrating the code's functionality. The classroom is filled with subtle tech elements like floating data particles and UI interfaces. The repository's name, 'Code2Video,' is subtly displayed on the whiteboard. The scene is in a 3D isometric illustration style with vibrant colors and a focus on clarity and understanding. The lighting is warm and inviting, creating a positive learning environment.

name: doomscroll-detector
description: Computer vision pipeline to detect and punish doomscrolling
readme_summary: The Doomscrolling Detector is a computer vision pipeline that identifies when a user is reclined and using their phone, indicative of doomscrolling behavior. It uses pose estimation and object detection to flag these instances, and includes a spoofed penalty counter as a humorous deterrent.
key_features: YOLOv11 pose estimation for keypoint tracking
YOLO object detection for phone detection
Heuristics for detecting reclined posture based on hip/shoulder alignment
Heuristics for detecting phone holding based on wrist proximity
Overlay of results on webcam feed with a spoofed penalty counter
cover_image_prompt: A frustrated digital shepherd is trying to wrangle a flock of glowing smartphones that are pulling people down into a dark pit labeled 'Doomscroll Abyss'. The shepherd uses a glowing staff that emits waves of 'Focus' to push the phones back. Small UI elements on the staff show posture detection and phone usage metrics. The scene is set on a stylized hilltop overlooking a digital landscape. The lighting is dramatic, with bright highlights on the shepherd and phones, and deep shadows in the abyss. The image should be in 3D isometric illustration style with vibrant colors and clear details.

name: WZML-X
description: A Super Enhanced Telegram bot which can download torrents, mega, google drive links, telegram file, direct links and all yt-dlp sites, upload to google drive, telegram cloud, rclone clouds or ddl servers. Made with Pyrogram in Python by WZML-X Devs.
readme_summary: WZML-X is a Telegram bot built with Pyrogram that enhances file mirroring and cloning capabilities. It supports downloading from various sources like torrents, Mega, Google Drive, and direct links, then uploading to Google Drive, Telegram, Rclone clouds, or DDL servers.
key_features: qBittorrent support with file selection and seeding options
Aria2c integration with file selection, netrc support, and authentication
Telegram upload/download with file splitting, thumbnail support, and leech options
Support for uploading files to specific Telegram supergroups
yt-dlp support for downloading from various sites
primary_use_case: Mirroring and cloning files from various online sources to different cloud storage platforms or Telegram.
cover_image_prompt: A diligent librarian meticulously copies ancient scrolls (representing online files) using a magical quill (the bot). The quill duplicates the scrolls onto various shelves labeled 'Google Drive,' 'Telegram Cloud,' and 'Rclone.' The librarian wears a high-tech headset displaying download progress and source links. Subtle digital particles float around the quill, symbolizing data transfer. A small screen in the background shows a simplified bot interface. The scene is set in a grand, futuristic library with soft, warm lighting. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with clear details and a vibrant color scheme.

name: UpUp
description: ✈️ Easily create sites that work offline as well as online
readme_summary: UpUp is a JavaScript library that enables offline functionality for websites by utilizing service workers. It allows developers to specify content to be displayed when users are offline, ensuring a consistent user experience even without an internet connection. The library is designed to be easy to implement, requiring only a few lines of JavaScript to configure.
key_features: Browser support for Chrome, Opera, and Firefox (with service worker support)
primary_use_case: Providing offline access to website content for users with intermittent or no internet connectivity.
cover_image_prompt: A lighthouse standing strong on a rocky coast, guiding ships safely even during a fierce storm. The lighthouse emits a bright, steady beam of light, representing the consistent availability of website content. Small screens embedded in the lighthouse walls display snippets of code and UI elements. Digital particles flow from the lighthouse, forming a protective shield around the ships. The scene is set at twilight with dramatic lighting and a blue and orange color scheme. The image should be in digital painting style with clean lines and clear details.
